title.narrative: PACT Promoting citizen engagement in decentralisation 2012-2016
PACT Ökat medborgerligt deltagande i decentralisering

description.narrative: I ljuset av den decentraliseringsprocessen behöver folkligt deltagande utvecklas i Kambodja. Projektet syftar specifikt till: 1. Ökad kommunikation mellan medborgarna 2. Ökat antal beslut tagna av valda församlingar på distriktsnivå är direkt påverkade av medborgarnas deltagande 3. Kambodjas politik kring decentralisering är mer påverkat av civila samhällets engagemang.

In light of the decentralization process in Cambodia, civic engagement needs to be further developed in Cambodia. The project aim at: 1. Increase communication among citizens 2. More district council actions are directly influenced by diverse citizen participation.3. Government policies around sub-national democratic development are more influenced by civil society.

sector.narrative: Decentralisation and support to subnational government

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Under its first objective, PROCEED increased knowledge and communication among diverse citizens that reflected their interest and participation at all council engagement events. As part of this effort, PROCEED increased the awareness of 18,525 diverse citizens (66% women) on understanding their civic rights, how to exercise their rights to demand services from the government, and how to hold elected authorities accountable for their pursuant decisions and actions. Under its second objective, PROCEED reduced constraints to citizen participation in local government affairs by directly building the confidence of citizens to demand information from government and to make their voices heard at government-led forums and events. PROCEED also brought about substantial changes in the behaviour and attitude of elected commune and district councils and administrations towards citizen participation in government affairs. Local councils rolled out eight citizen engagement mechanisms (over a total of 2,570 sessions), as a means of directly reaching and understanding the needs and priorities of their constituent citizens. Among the estimated 45,4213 participating citizens (57% female), 24% voiced their concerns and priorities at council events, and across 186 public forums citizens raised a total of 1,956 issues. While only 9.8% of these issues were fully addressed by government, council members demonstrated an openness to explain the reasons for not being able to address many of the issues raised and to answer other citizen questions. Under its third objective, PROCEED supported the civil society network, Working Group for Decentralization (WGPD), to influence the central government to increase its accountability level and attention paid to civic engagement. PROCEED supported WGPD to expand its reach to all provinces across the country and strengthened the capacity of the network to increase dialogue between network members as well as with external stakeholders. Among 91 key sub-national democratic development issues WGPD collected from network members, 85% were raised or submitted to the National Committee for Sub-National Democratic Development (NCDD) at policy meetings. WGPD also delivered eleven formal feedback statements to NCDD.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
